solution_line_template: On Monday Miriam does {monday_pushups} push-ups + {tuesday_pushups} push-ups on Tuesday = <<{monday_pushups}+{tuesday_pushups}={monday_tuesday_total}>>{monday_tuesday_total} push-ups on both days.

On Wednesday she does twice as many push-ups as she did on Tuesday, {tuesday_pushups} x {wednesday_multiplier} = <<{tuesday_pushups}*{wednesday_multiplier}={wednesday_pushups}>>{wednesday_pushups} push-ups on Wednesday.
Over the first 3 days, she did a total of {wednesday_pushups} + {monday_tuesday_total} = <<{wednesday_pushups}+{monday_tuesday_total}={total_first_three_days}>>{total_first_three_days} pushups

On Thursday Miriam did {thursday_fraction} the same number of total pushups she had already done that week, so she did {thursday_fraction} x {total_first_three_days} = <<{thursday_fraction}*{total_first_three_days}={thursday_pushups}>>{thursday_pushups} pushups on Thursday.

On Friday she does as many push-ups as the total of what she had done over the previous four days, so she did {monday_pushups} + {tuesday_pushups} + {wednesday_pushups} + {thursday_pushups} = <<{monday_pushups}+{tuesday_pushups}+{wednesday_pushups}+{thursday_pushups}={friday_pushups}>>{friday_pushups} push-ups on Friday.
